summary: An Ordinance providing for the issuance and sale of negotiable bonds of the City of Seattle in the sum of Two Million Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand ($2,250,000.00) Dollars to pay for the making of certain extensions to the Cedar River water supply system of the City of Seattle under the plan as adopted by Ordinance No. 3990, approved October 29, 1895, and duly ratified by the qualified voters of the City of Seattle at an election thereon held December 10, 1895, and creating and establishing a special fund to be called "Cedar River Water Supply Fund of Seattle, Series \#2", for the payment of the principal and interest on said bonds.
